item.title: Orchestrating Java Spring Boot applications with Nomad
item.dc:creator: Micha≈Ç Rutkowski
item.description:
Discover how HashiCorp Nomad can streamline the orchestration of Java Spring Boot applications alongside modern workloads. This article highlights Nomad‚Äôs ability to manage diverse applications without requiring complete rewrites, simplifying deployment and scaling processes. Learn about the benefits of using Nomad‚Äôs Java driver, service discovery, and externalized configuration for efficient application management. üöÄ #Java #SpringBoot #HashiCorp #Nomad #ApplicationManagement

Category: educational

item.title: Migrate your OpenShift logging stack from Elasticsearch to Loki
item.dc:creator: Micha≈Ç Rutkowski
item.description:
üöÄ To leverage the latest logging features in Red Hat OpenShift 6.0, migrating from Elasticsearch to Loki is essential. This guide details how to test changes in development and plan for production implementations. Loki, a scalable log aggregation system, offers improved performance by using log labels. It allows multiple tenants, which simplifies resource management. üîÑ The migration process involves running both stacks in parallel, ensuring old logs remain accessible via Elasticsearch while‚Ä¶

Source: Red Hat Developer Blog
Author: Oscar Casal Sanchez, Jamie Parker
Category: educational

item.title: A Developer's Guide to Building on the HubSpot Marketplace: The Swarm's Journey
item.dc:creator: Micha≈Ç Rutkowski
item.description:
üöÄ In the sales world, time is precious. The Swarm is addressing this challenge by creating an app card using HubSpot‚Äôs UI Extensions. Their platform maps relationships within a company‚Äôs network, helping sales teams identify trusted connections based on shared history and education. This integration allows for smoother workflows and credible conversations directly within HubSpot CRM. Explore their journey and insights on building in the HubSpot Marketplace! üåêü§ù #SalesEfficiency #HubSpot‚Ä¶

item.title: Troubleshooting network connectivity and performance with Cloudflare AI
item.dc:creator: Micha≈Ç Rutkowski
item.description:
üåê Troubleshooting network issues just got easier with Cloudflare AI! The complexity of corporate networks has increased, making it hard to pinpoint performance problems. Cloudflare introduces two new AI tools in their Secure Access Service Edge (SASE) platform, Cloudflare One, designed to simplify this process. The new WARP diagnostic analyzer helps users understand connectivity issues by analyzing extensive diagnostic logs. This tool is available for free, empowering users to resolve issues‚Ä¶

Source: Cloudflare Blog
Author: Koko Uko
Category: educational

item.title: Boost Your Copilot with SonarQube via Docker MCP Toolkit and Gateway

item.description:
üöÄ In the age of AI copilots, ensuring code quality is crucial. SonarQube helps identify bugs, test coverage, and security issues but can interrupt workflow due to feedback loops. üîß The solution? Integrate SonarQube directly into your IDE using the Sonar MCP server and Docker MCP Toolkit. This allows AI agents like GitHub Copilot to access code quality metrics seamlessly. üõ†Ô∏è The Docker MCP Toolkit simplifies the setup, enabling developers to focus on coding without distractions. For hands-on‚Ä¶

item.title: Migrating Ansible Automation Platform 2.4 to 2.5
item.dc:creator: Micha≈Ç Rutkowski
item.description:
üöÄ Migrating from Ansible Automation Platform 2.4 to 2.5 involves careful steps to ensure a smooth transition. This article outlines the preparation, export, and import process using the configify.aapconfig collection. Key points include: - Ensure Ansible Automation Platform 2.5 is deployed separately. - Follow similar steps as migrating from AWX 25. - Focus on user roles and authentication changes in the new version. For detailed steps, refer to the article! üìú #Ansible #Automation #DevOps‚Ä¶

Source: Red Hat Developer Blog
Author: Konstantin Kuminsky
Category: educational

item.title: Improving code quality - Session 44: Misdiagnosis of anemia
item.dc:creator: Micha≈Ç Rutkowski
item.description:
üõ†Ô∏è In the latest article by Munetoshi Ishikawa, the focus is on code quality through the lens of anemia misdiagnosis. The discussion revolves around two modules‚Äîfoo-module and bar-module‚Äîeach with their own data models: FooModel and BarModel. The article highlights how conversion logic between these models was integrated to avoid an anemic domain model, ensuring better data handling. For developers, this insight emphasizes the importance of architecture in maintaining clean code. #CodeQuality‚Ä¶

Source: LY Corporation Tech Blog
Author: Unknown
Category: educational

item.title: Implementing Asynchronous Human-in-the-Loop Authorization in Python with LangGraph and Auth0
item.dc:creator: Micha≈Ç Rutkowski
item.description:
Learn how to implement asynchronous authorization in your LangGraph application using Auth0 and the CIBA flow. This tutorial covers using a secondary device for secure permissions, allowing actions like financial transactions or order approvals with human oversight. Discover the importance of keeping humans in the loop for responsible AI actions. For more insights on CIBA, check out the linked blog post! üîêüì±ü§ñ #AsynchronousAuth #LangGraph #Auth0 #CIBA #ResponsibleAI
